component.name: s-nssai
component.description:
The components necessary to uniquely describe a S-NSSAI. {{enum}}
For example
* The most common usage where network slicing is not used:
* ServiceSliceType=eMBB
* When network slicng is used
* ServiceSliceType=eMBB
* SliceDifferentiator=3

parameter.name: SliceServiceType
parameter.description:
The Slice Service Type (SST). {{enum}}
See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.23.501|Clause 5.15.2.2}}.

parameter.name: SliceDifferentiator
parameter.description:
The Slice differentiator is an optional number used to differentiate network slices with the same SST.
See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.23.501|Clause 5.15.2.1}}.

object.name: Device.PDU.
object.description: The logical connection between the 5G-RG and data network is the Protocol Data Unit (PDU). The Device.PDU subtree describes each PDU sessions properties together with the QoS rules specific to that PDU session.

parameter.name: SessionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.PDU.Session.{i}.
object.description: Contains all the properties of a PDU session instance, ranging from maximum bitrate through to assigned network slice. This object contains the {{object}} table.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description: {{reference}} The IP Interface associated with the ''PDU'' entry.

parameter.name: SessionID
parameter.description: PDU session identity. See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.501|Clause 9.4}}.

parameter.name: PTI
parameter.description: Procedure transaction identity. See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.501|Clause 9.6}}.

parameter.name: SessionType
parameter.description: The PDU session type indicating the protocol the PDU is capable of carrying. See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.501|Clause 9.11.4.11}}. {{enum}}

parameter.name: SSC
parameter.description: Session and Service Continuity (SSC) Mode: Indicates that the traffic of the matching application shall be routed via a PDU Session supporting the included SSC Mode. See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.501|Clause 9.11.4.16}}

parameter.name: SessionAMBRDownlink
parameter.description: Downlink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate in {{units}}. See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.501|Clause 9.11.4.14}}.

parameter.name: SessionAMBRUplink
parameter.description: Uplink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate in {{units}}. See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.501|Clause 9.11.4.14}}.

parameter.name: LastError
parameter.description: Error code. See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.501|Clause 9.11.4.2}}

parameter.name: PDUIPv4Address
parameter.description: The IPv4 address allocated to the PDU session by the SMF. This parameter is only valid if {{param|SessionType}} has a value of {{enum|IPv4|SessionType}} or {{enum|IPv4v6|SessionType}}. See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.501|Clause 9.11.4.10}}.

parameter.name: PDUIPv6InterfaceIdentifier
parameter.description: The interface identifier for the IPv6 link local address allocated to the PDU session by the SMF. This parameter is only valid if {{param|SessionType}} has a value of {{enum|IPv6|SessionType}} or {{enum|IPv4v6|SessionType}}. See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.501|Clause 9.11.4.10}}.

parameter.name: RQTimerValue
parameter.description: Reflective QoS timeout in {{units}}. See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.501|Clause 9.11.2.3}}.

parameter.name: AlwaysOn
parameter.description:
Always on PDU session indication. The purpose of the Always-on PDU session indication information element is to indicate whether a PDU session is established as an always-on PDU session.
See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.501|clause 9.11.4.3}}.

parameter.name: DNN
parameter.description: The Data Network Name used by the PDU. The DNN value may be from the optional S-NSSAI specified at the time of PDU establishment or a default determined by the 5G core. A DNN is analagous to an LTE APN used the same format defined in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.501|clause 9.11.2.1A}}.

parameter.name: QoSRuleNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: QoSFlowNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.PDU.Session.{i}.PCO.
object.description: Policy Configuration Options (PCO) is an optional set of configuration parameters supplied by the network at the request of the 5G-RG as defined in {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.008|clause 10.5.6.3}}.

parameter.name: IPv6PCSCF
parameter.description: The IPv6 address of the P-CSCF used for VoLTE telephony.

parameter.name: IPv6DNS
parameter.description: A comma separated list of IPv6 DNS servers.

parameter.name: IPv4PCSCF
parameter.description: The IPv4 address of the P-CSCF used for VoLTE telephony.

parameter.name: IPv4DNS
parameter.description: A comma separated list of IPv4 DNS servers.

object.name: Device.PDU.Session.{i}.NetworkSlice.
Device.PDU.Session.{i}.QoSRule.{i}.
object.description:
This object describes the PDU QoS Rule table. The purpose of the QoS Rule table is to assign a QFI to mark traffic based on a set of classification rules. The rules are set by the netowrk operator and are specific for each PDU.
For example:
* A QoS Rule with a default used for general traffic has the following parameters.
* QFI=1
* DQR=1 - Default rule
* Filter 1 for rule
* Direction=bidirectional
* Type=1 - Match all
* A QoS Rule matchihg a voice service.
* QFI=32
* DQR=0
* Filter 1 for rule
* Direction=bidirectional
* Type=33 - Destination IPv6 range
* Value=2001:8000/48 - Destination IPv6 range
* Filter 2 for rule
* Direction=bidirectional
* Type=16 - Destination IPv4 address with netmask
* Value=203.1.0.0 255.255.255.0 - Destination IPv4 address with netmask
A full description can be found at {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.501|clause 9.11.4.13}} QoS Rules

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Identifier
parameter.description: The QoS rule identifier field is used to identify the QoS rule.

parameter.name: Precedence
parameter.description: The QoS rule precedence field is used to specify the precedence of the QoS rule among all QoS rules. The higher the value of the QoS rule precedence field, the lower the precedence of that QoS rule is.

parameter.name: Segregation
parameter.description: In the UE to network direction the segregation bit indicates whether the UE is requesting the network to bind service data flows described by the QoS rule to a dedicated QoS Flow. When {{true}} segregation is requested.

parameter.name: QFI
parameter.description: QoS Flow identifier.

parameter.name: DQR
parameter.description: Default QoS rule flag. When {{true}} this QoS rule is the default QoS rule.

parameter.name: FilterNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.PDU.Session.{i}.QoSRule.{i}.Filter.{i}.
object.description: This object describes the PDU QoS Rule Filter table. As each packet filter is logically anded with the others, there shall not be more than one occurrence of each packet filter component type.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Direction
Type
parameter.description: Packet filter component type identifier. See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.501|Clause 9.11.4.13}}.

parameter.name: Value
parameter.description: Matching value for the component type. See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.501|Clause 9.11.4.13}}.

object.name: Device.PDU.Session.{i}.QoSFlow.{i}.
object.description:
Table of all QoS Flow Indicators (QFI) and their properties supported by the access network for this particular PDU.
For example:
* A QoS Flow with a QFI of 1 used for general traffic has the following parameters.
* FiveQI=8
* A QoS Flow with a QFI of 32 used for voice traffic with a guaranteed bitrate of 150k has the following parameters.
* FiveQI=1
* GFBRUplink=150
* GFBRDownlink=150

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: QFI
parameter.description: QoS Flow Identifier.

parameter.name: FiveQI
parameter.description: 5G QoS Identifier. See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.23.501|Clause 5.7.4}} for a table of standardised 5QI QoS characteristics.

parameter.name: GFBRUplink
parameter.description: Guaranteed Flow Bitrate - Upstream (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: GFBRDownlink
parameter.description: Guaranteed Flow Bitrate - Downstream (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: MFBRUplink
parameter.description: Maximum Flow Bitrate - Upstream (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: MFBRDownlink
parameter.description: Maximum Flow Bitrate - Downstream (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: AveragingWindow
parameter.description: Averaging window for both uplink and downlink in {{units}}.

parameter.name: EPSBearer
parameter.description: EPS Bearer Identity. See {{bibref|3GPP-TS.24.301|Clause 9.3.2}}.
